name: Richard Velasquez
htmldesc:
Ex Uber driver turned product engineer.

Ex-Facebook. Launched & maintained two billion dollar products at FB. Founder of Kanbee, an app that pays people to budget using DeFi.

name: Michelle Tsing
post: Community, Standard || Host, Laptop Radio ||  AR & NFT Artist, @BITGODDESSES || Cofounder, Eight Meta || Cofounder, Governance Research Institute || Managing Partner, Cognito Capital
htmldesc:
Michelle Tsing was an attorney at PayPal, where she helped the Large Merchant Services team achieved ubiquity. Prior to PayPal, she was at Cisco, eBay, Samsung and Apple.

She co-founded a blockchain payments startup in 2015 and is an advisor to a number of AI, blockchain and 3D printing companies. She is also a mentor for Singularity University Ventures, Berkeley Blockchain Accelerator, SVI Academy and Hack Temple, which are tech incubators located in the United States. She founded Robotics for Good: Chatbots, Messaging and AI community; and had donated her time to The Loving AI/XPRIZE Project, Compute for Cancer and Robots Without Borders. She is a member of the California and Georgia blockchain advocacy coalitions. She is also producer and host of Laptop Radio at Stanford University. Michelle is a cofounder at Governance Research Institute (non profit on e-governance and blockchain) and Eight Meta (spatial and XR NFTs). She is a community director at Standard Protocol. She is Managing Partner at Cognito Capital and a NFT artist as bitgoddesses. linktr.ee/bitgoddesses

name: Corey Mccauley
htmldesc: Corey Mccauley is an Cofounder of EightMeta and speaker. He has over 10 plus years of tech experience from military service combined with cybersecurity, investigations and blockchain consulting. He started in the blockchain community in 2017 as an advisor and investor. He's passionate about the blockchain ecosystem and is speaker on multiple topics such as privacy, security, mining, mental health, traveling and much more. Additionally he is a consultant at CyberMindfulSolutions.com & Blocktech Atlanta.

name: Eliott Teissonniere
htmldesc: Eliott Teissonniere is a polymath, engineer and entrepreneur. He used to be the CTO of BitNation, a governance and crypto company which was rewarded by the NetExplo prize from UNESCO in 2017, made the world’s first marriage dApp on Ethereum and leads Nodle's Blockchain and Engineering teams for which he co-invented various pending and granted patents. He was featured in various medias for his work on decentralized governance and blockchains such as Decrypt, CoinTelegraph and CoinDesk; and spoke at various high profile events such as the Paris Blockchain Week, the Stanford Blockchain Conference and presented in front of the European commission with past European deputies on the subject of Covid-19 tracing via the Blockchain. He is a mentor at the Berkeley Blockchain Accelerator and advises various crypto and technology startups via his company Nuclei Studio. He cofounded in 2020 the Governance Research Institute to research new governance models for companies, communities and governments.

name: Tristan Roberts
post: Summoner of hybrid legal / decentralized entities
htmldesc: Tristan's involvement in the crypto-anarcho BitNation lead him to pursue a deeper understanding of how DAOs could integrate with the existing legal jurisdictions. Aside from automating formation processes, he writes on decentralizing science through emerging knowledge markets.

name: Miko Matsumura
htmldesc:
Miko is a General Partner with Gumi Ventures, a US $30M investment fund focused early stage blockchain startups and a cofounder of crypto exchange Evercoin

Miko fell in love with open source software 25 years ago as chief Evangelist for the Java Language and Platform at Sun Microsystems. Since then he has been building open source software startups in Silicon Valley including raising over $50 million in venture capital for developer platform companies such as Gradle and financial infrastructure companies like Hazelcast and has participated in multiple exits including INFRAVIO, webMethods, and Db4O. He is an advisor in successful startups like Celsius (CeFi Lending), Idle Finance (DeFi Yield Aggregator), Pundi X (Payments), and KEYLESS (ID infrastructure). He has been an investor with Focus Ventures, a firm with over $800M under management, 9 IPOs and 44 exits and blockchain firm Pantera Capital. He holds a Master’s degree in Neuroscience from Yale University where he worked on abstract computational neural networks.

name: Joshua Baker
htmldesc:
COO of System 9, a cryptocurrency market maker.

Joshua Baker is the COO of System 9, a cryptocurrency market maker. He also contributes articles to Hackernoon and previously exited a steel technology firm.

name: Aly Madhavji
post: Managing Partner at Blockchain Founders Fund and LP at Loyal VC & Draper Goren Holm
htmldesc:
Aly Madhavji 穆亚霖 is the Managing Partner at Blockchain Founders Fund which invests in and venture builds top-tier startups.

Aly Madhavji 穆亚霖 is the Managing Partner at Blockchain Founders Fund which invests in and venture builds top-tier startups. He is a Limited Partner on Loyal VC and Draper Goren Holm. Aly consults organizations on emerging technologies such as INSEAD and the UN on solutions to help alleviate poverty. He is a Senior Blockchain Fellow at INSEAD and was recognized as a “Blockchain 100” Global Leader by Lattice80. He is an internationally acclaimed author, publishing three books and a monthly columnist for the leading blockchain magazine. Aly serves as a board member of CryptoStar Corp. (TSXV: CSTR), Mechanical Technology Incorporated (NASDAQ: MKTY) and has served on various advisory boards including the University of Toronto’s Governing Council, which manages a $2.5B budget. He is a mentor with Chinaccelerator, an elite accelerator program operated by the venture fund SOSV with $855M+ AUM and the Mobile Only Accelerator (MOX). Aly holds a Master of Global Affairs as a Schwarzman Scholar from Tsinghua University (清华大学), a Master of Business Administration from INSEAD (Singapore and France), and a Bachelor of Commerce with Distinction from the University of Toronto.

name: Clayton Roche
htmldesc:
Community Lead at UMA (Universal Market Access) and the co-founder of the DeFi Nation group.

Clayton is the Community Lead at UMA (Universal Market Access) and the co-founder of the DeFi Nation group. He participated in the second PoolTogether lottery, interviewed Stani to celebrate $5M locked in Aave, and narrowly dodged the first bZx exploit.

name: Tsolmondorj Natsagdorj
htmldesc: Serial Fintech Entrepreneur with 2 exits. Has consulted with Defense, Fortune 500, and multiple governments and banks in emerging markets.

name: Kamal Hubbard
htmldesc: Author | Advisor | Civil Rights Officer

name: Alex Hatoum
htmldesc:
Alex Hatoum is the Managing Director at Infinitum Humanitarian Systems (IHS), a private sector social business built on a profit-for-purpose model, and focused on global health and capacity building in the developing world. He is responsible for all international business initiatives, including business incubation management and overseas research support.

Hatoum, a native speaker of English, Spanish, Portuguese and French, has traveled extensively throughout the Americas, working in both governmental and private sector positions. After an education in multiple countries that included a degree in International Business and in an extended program in International Security and Conflict Resolution at San Diego State University, he accepted a position with the US Marshals Service on their Violent Crimes Task Force. During those years Hatoum worked alongside the US military on a broad range of trans-boundary issues before accepting a commission from the United States Army. There he continued to work on issues relating to information flow across international boundaries. After seven years of decorated service, he left the Army to continue his education, completing a Master’s degree in Homeland Security. After graduation, he took an assignment with the US Office of National Drug Control Policy where he worked on several cross-border policy projects. Alex has been in the blockchain space since 2016 and specifically with Polkadot since 2018. In 2020 Alex became a Polkadot Ambassador.

name: Olayinka Odeniran
htmldesc:
Olayinka is the founder and CEO of CybSecWatch, boutique governance, risk and compliance educational consulting firm.

She brings more than 18 years of executive experience in risk management and compliance. Olayinka is an insightful and forward-thinking expert with extensive experience ensuring fulfillment of firm policies, procedures and federal mandates governing compliance and cybersecurity. Olayinka brings her driven/ innovative mindset to provide information assurance to help strengthen the enterprise cybersecurity landscape. As a blockchain enthusiast Olayinka is involved in several blockchain projects promoting women and minorities in tech and has co-founder Black Women Blockchain Council, a benefit LLC promoting black women in blockchain, fintech and future technologies. In her spare time, Olayinka writes for various publications and has also been a speaker at various conferences on regulations, cybersecurity and blockchain. Olayinka holds a M. Sc in Cybersecurity Management and Policy from the University of Maryland Global College and a BA from Boston University.

name: Adam Vaziri
htmldesc:
Adam is the founder and CEO of Blockpass - a self sovereign identity application for regulated industries.

Adam Vaziri's background is as a blockchain lawyer and set up Diacle in 2013 to assist blockchain projects with compliance. Adam has worked on the development of regulations in crypto in the early days in 2013 onwards. He was the first lawyer specialised in crypto in 2013. Adam believes that Web3.0 will bring blockchain to the mainstream but that regtech is required. Adam is Technical Author of the British Standards Institution standard on security tokens PAS19668:2020. Adam co-founded the UK Digital Currency Association and cofounded bitlegal.io which was at the time the most renowned tracker for the legal status of bitcoin (as featured by CNN and Washington Post). Adam also set up the first bitcoin hackathon in the UK and India labelled HackCoin. Adam has been involved in the development of standards for crypto-assets. He co-founded a fund called QRC to invest in regtech businesses and develop standards. QRC collaborated with the University of Malaya in the development of legal research into aspects of crypto-assets. QRC sponsored the development of a data standard for Security Tokens and Adam was the Technical Author of the same.

name: Zeb Lelie
post: Head of the Research Department, Cyber Capital. Crypto Asset Investments & Funds.
htmldesc:
Zeb Lelie has been involved with Cyber Capital as a Research Associate since the start of the firm in 2016.

He has an academic background in Political Science and Political History at the University of Amsterdam. This path has led him towards Bitcoin in 2014 and ever since he learned about the power of programmable money, crypto has taken hold of his life. Besides Cyber Capital, Zeb worked with the Blockchain Meetup in Hanoi and at the Blockchain Workspace of Amsterdam, a blockchain development group. Aside from offline discussions, Zeb also became an active participant in on-chain DeFi governance. Back in 2015 he founded the DYOR Crypto Wiki, a comprehensive database focused on the crypto-sphere. Through his reputation within the space, he became an advisor to multiple projects and research groups. At Cyber Capital, Zeb takes care of extensive analysis on crypto assets and has been heading the research department since 2020.

name: Pooja Sinha
post: Attorney at Law, Forte Law LLC
htmldesc:
Pooja is an international lawyer based in Singapore. She is an Associate Director (Registered Foreign Lawyer) at Singapore law firm Forte Law LLC.

She is a corporate finance specialist with the unique ability to advise clients in both the traditional and new age economy. She has closed 100+ transactions in the US, Europe and Asia in the course of her 20+ career including several first-of-its-kind transactions. Her new age experience includes guiding technology-enabled businesses on a range of matters from their regulatory licensing strategy, contractual risk mitigation strategy and fundraising through both the traditional and new age routes. She has a wide range of experience within the digital economy having advised on everything from ICOs, STOs, IEOs and most recently, NFTs. She has also advised on the set-up of investment funds in the digital token space. She also holds a number of compliance-related certifications – the International Compliance Association's Advanced Certificate in Governance, Risk and Compliance, the PDPC’s Practitioner Certificate in Personal Data Protection and the CIPP (Asia) and the CIPM certifications from the International Association of Privacy Professionals. Pooja has spoken extensively on legal and regulatory issues at panel events within the blockchain industry. Recently, she has also started penning down her thoughts on the inerplay between the traditional and the new age economy on Medium under the handle sinha-pooja.

name: Álvaro Fernández Tenorio
htmldesc:
Majored in Economics and Finance, Alvaro has developed his career around the Blockchain & FinTech Industry, as venture capitalist, consultant and strategist.

Currently head of strategy and growth at Nsure Network, an open insurance platform for Open Finance (DeFi). The project is inspired by Lloyd’s London, a market place to trade insurance risks, where premiums are determined by a dynamic pricing model.. Previously Vice President and Managing Director for Europe at JRR Group. Despite his entrepreneurial experience, he has served as Strategic Advisor and consulted various projects and institutions, including DBS & former Italian Undersecretary of State for the Ministry of Economic Development.

name: Amanda
htmldesc:
Traditional finance background, but made the switch to crypto in 2017

when colleagues started quitting after becoming Bitcoin millionaires overnight. Focused on making the many aspects of Sushi make sense and building the Sushi ecosystem out to convince all the traditional finance people left behind to also make the switch.

name: Eddie Kago
post: Founder and CEO of Vibranium ID
htmldesc:
Eddie is the Founder and CEO of Vibranium ID, a Kenyan Digital Identity startup developing KYC solutions and Blockchain Identity wallets.

He conceptualized and helped architect Kweli (kweli-ssi.web.app), a software framework that can be used for Pan-African blockchain supported digital identity. He frequently writes about Decentralized Identity on his Medium blog (medium.com/@kago) and is the Community Lead of Facebook Developer Circle Nairobi. Eddie holds a BSc in Business Information Technology, First Class Honours, from Strathmore University. Notably, Eddie is a finalist of the Rhodes Scholars Program and is an alumnus of the Obama-initiated Young African Leadership Initiative (YALI). He is also a 2020 candidate of the Crossroads Emerging Leaders Program by the Harvard Business School Club of the GCC.

name: Hyungsuk Kang
htmldesc:
Hyungsuk Kang is a software engineer with strong background in cryptocurrency, blockchain, and distributed ledger technology.

He is the CTO and Cofounder of Standard Protocol, Polkadot's first stablecoin based synthetic asset defi protocol. He is also a software engineer at Plasm, Head Ambassador for East Asia of Polkadot, and Co-founder at PolkaKR. With his versatility from over 5 years of research and development in software and cutting edge industries, he enjoys solving technical challenges.

name: Shimon Newman
htmldesc: Game theorist, token economist and incentive designer. Building the future of collateralized based stable minting and permissionless asset management.

name: Samiar Tehrani
htmldesc: Platform and business developer. Building the future of collateralized based stable minting and permissionless asset management.

name: Mathias Abdissa
htmldesc:
Mathias is an entrepreneur, engineer, and product builder with very solid engineering background, who has lead and built financial, e-commerce, real estate, and crypto currency products.

Currently focused on building Santym to help Africans access to U.S. banking system, DeFi Saving accounts and Crypto custody. Past Experience: - Founded an e-commerce startup and generated ~$0.4M in revenue in 12 months and under 4 employees with no capital. - Founded a SaaS startup and lead a team of 5-8 engineers to build software applications for hardware components. - Built global relationships in China, UAE, and Philippines for e-commerce and consulting businesses. - Built a funnel and run social media ads to generate leads.

name: Justin Newton
htmldesc:
Justin Newton is the CEO and co-founder of Netki, the leader in digital ID validation solutions for Onboarding, KYC/AML and Travel Rule compliance.

Netki’s solutions help wallet providers, exchanges, banks, fintech, governments and any company using blockchain technology comply with recent FATF, FINMA and FinCen guidance, while maintaining the principles of privacy and autonomy on which blockchain and cryptocurrency are founded. Justin has strategically positioned Netki to lead the charge in setting standards and policy for enterprise, digital identification, and digital currency ecosystems. Justin currently serves on the Industry/Law Enforcement Portal Working Group of the Blockchain Alliance and the State Legislative Working Group of the Chamber of Digital Commerce. Netki is a highly sought after participant to government-led initiatives on Digital Identity by US Treasury, the Monetary Authority of Singapore, the Central Bank of Aruba and other global agencies. Justin is a pioneer in the development of Internet and blockchain technology. Justin previously served on the Advisory Council for ARIN, the multinational registry for IP addresses and founded ISPC, the first trade association for Internet providers. He played a key role in ensuring the Internet Tax Freedom, the Communications Decency, the Digital Copyright, and the CAN-SPAM Acts aided the Internet industry’s growth while ensuring security and privacy for its users. He is the only person that has contributed to authoring Internet standards (RFCs) and Bitcoin standards (BIPs).

name: Warren Lorenz
htmldesc:
Warren Lorenz is the Founder & Managing Principal of TechMeetsTrader and a Venture Partner at Blockchain Founders Fund which both invests in and venture build top-tier startups. He is a Limited Partner at multiple digital asset hedge funds, and sits on the Board of Directors of CryptoStar (TSX.V CSTR), a data center and cryptocurrency mining operator.

He is an entrepreneur with multiple trading systems that were built, licensed, and sold to Hedge Funds, Proprietary Trading Offices, and Family Offices. Prior to that, he had exited an EdTech company that he helped scale from 7 Universities to 130 within 12 months. He currently acts as an advisor for multiple companies ranging from FinTech, Ecommerce, and Blockchain technologies. Additionally, Warren was part of Batch 13 at 500 Startups VC out of Mountain View, California, where he and 32 other companies developed their businesses. He was a licensed Investment Advisor at Northwestern Mutual, where he passed FINRA’s Series 7 and Series 66 exams, and is an active investor across multiple industries.

name: Peter Okwara
htmldesc: He is passionate about Blockchain, Internet of Things, Data and using using Human Centered Design to solve problems that occur all around us. His goal is to be at the forefront in providing software and hardware solutions in Africa.

name: Jörn Erbguth
htmldesc:
Jörn Erbguth is a consultant on blockchain and data protection (GDPR). With majors in computer science and law, he takes a multidisciplinary approach to new technology.

. He is an enabler of privacy by design where legal and technological aspects need to be tightly integrated. Jörn previously worked as a software developer, a product manager and was head of ICT and CTO for legal information systems in Germany and Switzerland. He has been invited to the European Commission, the German Bundestag and the Parliament of Sachsen to discuss Blockchain, data protection and information security. Jörn writes about technology and law and lectures at the Geneva School of Diplomacy, the University of Lucerne and the University of St. Gallen. He is active in Blockchain standardization at the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) and was a member of DIN SPEC 4997 Privacy by Blockchain Design. He works with Geneva Macro Labs as Head of Technology Insights. Jörn also serves as a board member for the German EDV-Gerichtstag (German Association for Computing in the Judiciary) and the Swiss entscheidsuche.ch association. The latter engages in making Swiss court cases easily and freely available to the public. He organizes workshops at UN conferences on these topics such as the Internet Governance Forum IGF and the World Summit of Information Society WSIS.

name: Patrick Larsen
htmldesc:
Pat is the Cofounder and CEO of ZenLedger.io, a cryptocurrency tax and accounting startup

Pat and his cofounder, Bryan Starbuck, launched ZenLedger in 2017 and now work with Big 4 accounting firms, thousands of tax professionals, and tens of thousands of cryptocurrency investors. Pat holds a BS in Materials Science Chemistry from the US Air Force Academy and a MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. Pat has worked at Amazon and investment banking. He was also a US Navy helicopter pilot.

name: DJ Journey
post: CREATIVE DIRECTOR, COMPOSER/DJ & GRAPHIC ARTIST. CO-FOUNDER OF  FORM-U.LA
htmldesc: SHAPING THE FUTURE OF TECHNOLOGY, MUSIC, GAMING & COMMUNITY BUILDING. Favorite emote: 🚀 Discography: https://open.spotify.com/artist/4usoKnEFArgnDYsq93Sal9?si=CTrX8WbDQFC5CK_iGViJmw Brand: https://solo.to/vibestreambeats

name: Rodrigo Vicuna
htmldesc: Rodrigo Vicuna is the Chief Financial Officer at Prime Trust. Rodrigo has over ten years of experience at the intersection of financial services and technology. Prior to Prime Trust, Rodrigo was the CFO of BitGo, one of the world’s largest digital asset custodians. Rodrigo also worked at the Boston Consulting Group, where he focused on the digitalization of legacy capital markets infrastructure and service providers. He co-authored BCG's global perspective on emerging FinTech trends and potential opportunities for traditional finance to innovate. He also led the modernization of consumer loans for one of Chile's largest banks. Rodrigo guest lectures for Carnegie Mellon University's Chief Risk Officer and Chief Information Security Officer executive education programs. Rodrigo holds a bachelor's degree in economics with an emphasis in accounting from UCLA and an MBA from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

name: Tony Rose
htmldesc: Tony Rose, Founder & CEO Proof Market. Proof Market was founded to empower individuals to take custody of and control their own data with emerging privacy by design Digital Identity technology. The company initiated the Linux Foundation Public Health COVID-19 Credentials Initiative, the US Vaccine Credentials Focus Group, and led the introduction of AB 2004 in California authorizing verifiable credentials for COVID-19 and other medical test results. Proof Market developed and contributed the MedCreds platform to the Linux Foundation, helping to keep the film industry operating during the pandemic. Tony is on the drafting committee for the Good Health Pass Collaborative Interoperability Framework at the Trust over IP Foundation. Proof Market is now developing the Good Health Pass specification in open source at the Linux Foundation for Public Health.

name: Jor Law
post:
Board Director, Prime Trust  &
Consultant, tZERO/VerifyInvestor.com
htmldesc: An entrepreneur who has successfully built and exited his own startup, Jor combines his experience as a corporate/securities attorney, tech investor, startup founder, and product manager to bring additional depth to management teams. Jor has been a pioneer in developing fintech infrastructure and payment solutions for the crypto industry as well as creating the ecosystem for digitizing and trading securities on the blockchain and other distributed ledger technologies. In this capacity, he has helped build products and business units for some of the most prominent companies in the space.

name: Bharat Verma
htmldesc: Serial Entrepreneur with over 11 years of multi-dimensional experience background in Software Development, Biz Dev, Law, Real Estate and Marketing. Holds triple degrees in Computer Science Engineering, a Masters degree in Business and Management from the UK and a Bachelors of Law degree with honors. Blockchain investor since early 2017 and have worked with multiple projects in the space.

name: Robert Miller
htmldesc: Robert Miller is a growth consultant and heads up marketing and communications at Fuse, a payment-centric blockchain project that builds plug ’n’ play business solutions designed to allow anyone to take part in creating the economies of tomorrow. Having started his career in enterprise technology over 10 years a go, he now has over 5 years experience within blockchain and crypto having worked with Komodo Platform, Cointelegraph and other reputable names.

name: Johan Unger
htmldesc: Entrepreneur in online publishing for 10 years. Previously co-founder of Strossle, a top 20 growth startups in Europe. Started Meme.com (then Marble.Cards) in 2018.

name: Usman Majeed
htmldesc: Usman Majeed is the Founder/CEO at GooseFX, a full suite DeFi platform built on Solana implementing P2P yield farming, tokenized stocks, and derivatives trading. He also founded Quantum Labs which is an automated trading firm for automated directional, market making, and arbitrage bots. Usman has years of experience in algorithmic trading, Web3 dev, and mining operations.

name: Thomas Cox
htmldesc:
Thomas Cox is a systems integrator of the best ideas in the world for solving the problems of cooperation at any scale – from workplace teams to global collectives.

Thomas helps enterprise clients working on blockchain cooperation through DLT Governance Solutions (DLTgov.io). He chairs IEEE P2145 "Blockchain Governance Standards". He helps individuals and workplace teams through Eudae LLC via his Becoming a Best Boss training and coaching practice. Thomas graduated from the University of Chicago, earning his four-year degree in three years with honors. He’s worked with or for IBM, Oracle, PwC, Intel, and dozens of other firms large and small. He lives in the Pacific Northwest of the United States with his wife Tess.

name: March Zheng
htmldesc: March began investing in the blockchain industry in late 2016, when he discovered Ethereum and Bitcoin. March offers a unique investment perspective that incorporates advanced understanding of Eastern and Western cultures. March’s residency in China has proven invaluable to Bizantine’s success, providing eyes on the ground of cryptocurrency’s largest market, as Asian sentiment has more market power than American sentiment in driving short-term trends. Despite Bizantine’s focus on long-term trends, short-term movements must be understood in order to continue to hold conviction in long-term investments. March graduated from Washington and Lee University with a B.A. in Economics and East Asian Studies.

name: Shreyansh Singh
htmldesc: Shreyansh Singh has been an integral part of Polygon since 2 years, growing the NFT and Gaming ecosystem from scratch and has worked with innovative teams like Zed Run, Megacryptopolis etc. He is also a Metaverse Degen who loves discovering the future of metaverses.

name: Hon. Ben Bartlett
htmldesc: Berkeley City Councilmember and Fmr. Vice Mayor Ben Bartlett is a nationally recognized policy leader. Ben has authored and passed more than 60 measures focused on innovation, opportunity, and inclusion. Ben is a member of the State of California Blockchain Working Group and is working to integrate government and Blockchain through public finance, currencies, and data markets. Ben is architect of Berkeley’s Microbond offering using blockchain technology to issue bonds and executed the first compliant crypto cannabis transaction. Ben is author of the Smart Path Blockchain investment and policy thesis. Professionally, Ben is a partner in Tackett Bartlett LLP where he provides counsel for Blockchain entrepreneurs, governments, funds, and businesses.

name: Sahabia Yakubu
post: African ambassador for MakerDAO & Cryptolocally, and founder of DeFi Africa
htmldesc: Sahabia Yakubu: a Ghanaian-born and based cryptocurrency promoter, writer and speaker. Currently, African ambassador for MakerDAO & Cryptolocally, and founder of DeFi Africa

name: Chris Deschenes
htmldesc:
Chris Deschenes, the Director of Operations at Kalamint is a South Carolina resident, a former Marine of the US Armed Forces, a graduate of the EBV program at Syracuse University in New York and an entrepreneur at heart.

After completing two back-to-back combat tours to the Middle East, Chris embarked on his entrepreneurial journey as a SDVOSB (Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business) owner. Having seen the need for a financially borderless world during his deployments, Chris fell in love with the idea of cryptocurrency after being introduced to it by a friend. As an early adopter in the blockchain space, he brings his years of experience as a strategist, thinker and an executor for Kalamint as the Director of Operations.

name: Bryce Weiner
htmldesc: Bryce started as a drive time FM disc jockey on a small market radio station in the Midwest before embarking on a 15 year career as a Fortune 500 software developer for firms such as Thomson Reuters and Lockheed Martin. Beginning his blockchain engineering career in 2012 by building his own Bitcoin mining farm and now with over a dozen blockchain networks to his credit (several are currently publicly traded), Bryce is one of the most experienced blockchain engineers in the industry. He has been frequently consulted by financial institutions, news organizations, and courts of law for his irreverent and sometimes controversial views of blockchain technology, its implementation, and its potential. Bryce is CEO of Tao Records, founder of the Tao Network, a public blockchain network specifically tailored to suit the needs of music industry applications, and CTO of US based cryptocurrency exchange AltMarket, Inc.

name: Ravin Dave
htmldesc: Ravin is a creative executive with 20+ years of entertainment and 10+ years of integrated marketing communication, and strategic brand building experience. Focused on developing a sustainable model for an independent creative career. Currently hosts weekly VR Eight Meta parties as a performing NFT artist, and is the Creative Director of Weed Cellars.

name: Brent Powell
htmldesc: Brent brings over 23 years of executive level recruiting experience to the team. Brent’s previous experience includes serving as a Head of Talent Acquisition for a global venture capital fund, building early stage startups, and serving seed to mid-stage startups as a retained recruitment leader. In addition to managing the Talent Acquisition team, Brent handles projects across all sectors and and is involved in setting strategies for all skill areas.

name: Ryan Hanley
htmldesc: Ryan, Director of Partnerships at Coinfirm, helps VASPs, banks and government agencies better understand cryptocurrency AML and Counter Terrorism Financing risks through powerful analytics and on-chain intelligence. Currently accelerating the adoption of DeFi by FIs through a pioneering solution - giving greater clarity of AML/CTF risk exposure across liquidity pools. Ryan holds advisory roles with Qredo.com (http://qredo.com/) and Devv.io (http://devv.io/). He frequently hosts podcasts for the London-based Crypto Curry Club. While MD of TokenMarket, a leading technology platform for the issuance of digital assets and securities on the blockchain, he selected and helped 31 projects raise over $350m via the platform, distributing tokens to 250,000+ investors.

name: Chester Bella
htmldesc: Chester Bella is a Product Developer & Co-founder of ETHA Lend. He has ventured into the blockchain space since 2013 and has extensive experience in banking and in the fintech sector. During his explorations of the broader Defi space, he quickly realized that identifying the optimal yields becomes intimidating for the average user, in two domains -- It is hard to understand and hard to execute. He developed with his team a protocol that leverages innovative tools including an intelligent discovery algorithm to make the yield optimization simple and elegant for the average user, irrespective of their history and experiences with the Defi space.

name: Travin Keith
htmldesc: Travin Keith is a Co-Founder of Immunefi, the largest bug bounty platform focused on cryptocurrency projects such as those around decentralized finance (DeFi). Immunefi has over $1.7 million dollars in bug bounties paid out in just 6 months and holds the record for having one of the largest single bug bounty payouts at USD 800 000. The platform currently has prevented over $1bn in economic damage so far and currently has over $23 million in rewards available and is open to anyone to get started, find bugs, build rep, and get paid. In addition to Immunefi, Travin has an extensive background and range of experiences from having lived in eight countries across four continents. These experiences include large open source related projects like co-authoring the white paper of Hyperledger, a Linux Foundation project, providing technical architecture to the European Commission’s Blockchain4EU project, writing for the Open Source Initiative, and developing informational material to the 4T-DLT initiative of Digital Switzerland. It also includes startups like co-founding STOKR, an STO platform on Ethereum and the Liquid Network by Blockstream and many other smaller open source projects. He has also been involved with educational projects around blockchain and crypto at ETH Zurich, such as BIOTS and BETH, and has been a regular public speaker, including at the annual Hackers’ Congress in Prague, Consensus by CoinDesk, Open Source Summit: Europe, and the Open Source Leadership Summit.

name: Steve Hoffman
htmldesc: Steve Hoffman, or Captain Hoff as he’s called in Silicon Valley, is the Captain & CEO of Founders Space, one of the world’s leading startup accelerators. He’s also a venture investor, serial entrepreneur, and author of several award-winning books. These include “Make Elephants Fly” (published by Hachette) and “Surviving a Startup” (published by HarperCollins). Hoffman was founder and Chairman of the Producers Guild Silicon Valley Chapter, served on the Board of Governors of the New Media Council, and was a founding member of the Academy of Television’s Interactive Media Group. While in Hollywood, Hoffman worked as a TV development executive at Fries Entertainment, known for producing over a hundred TV shows, acquired by MGM. He went on to pioneer interactive television with his venture-funded startup Spiderdance, which produced interactive TV shows with NBC, MTV, Turner, Warner Brothers, History Channel, Game Show Network, and others. In Silicon Valley, Hoffman founded two more venture-backed startups, in the areas of games and entertainment, and worked as Mobile Studio Head for Infospace, with such hit mobile games as Tetris, Wheel of Fortune, Tomb Raider, Thief, Hitman, Skee-Ball, and X-Files. Hoffman went on to launch Founders Space, with the mission to educate and accelerate entrepreneurs. Founders Space has become one of the top startup accelerators in the world. Hoffman has trained hundreds of startup founders and corporate executives in the art of innovation and provided consulting to many of the world’s largest corporations, including Qualcomm, Huawei, Bosch, Intel, Disney, Warner Brothers, NBC, Gulf Oil, Siemens, and Viacom. Hoffman earned a bachelor’s degree in computer engineering from the University of California and a master’s degree in film and television from the University of Southern California. He currently resides in San Francisco but spends most of his time in the air, visiting startups, investors, and innovators all over the world.

name: Andrew Tu
htmldesc: Andrew Tu is a business development manager at Efficient Frontier, a crypto algorithmic trading and market making firm trading $150-200M every day. He first entered the crypto space in 2014 when he joined the Bitcoin Association of Berkeley, which became Blockchain at Berkeley in 2016. While at Berkeley, he partnered with some friends to form Partial f, an early DeFi synthetics startup. He later joined EF as an early employee in 2019 and now co-leads the DeFi arm of the firm.

name: Lou Kerner
post:
Partner, Blockchain Coinvestors &
Head Crypto Analyst, Quantum Economics
htmldesc: Lou Kerner is Partner at Blockchain Coinvestors, a leading crypto fund-of-fund that also invests directly in crypto companies. Lou is also the Head Crypto Analyst at Quantum Economics, a leading Crypto advisory firm. Lou has been a Crypto enthusiast, investor, and thought leader since 2013, when the Wall Street Journal called Lou “Wall Street’s Bitcoin Expert”. Lou regularly hosts conference calls with Crypto industry innovators attended by hundreds of Crypto enthusiasts and investors from around the world. Lou is ranked among the most influential Crypto bloggers on Medium, regularly keynotes major Crypto industry events, and often appears on TV or in print talking about Crypto. Previously, Lou was a Founding Partner of CryptoOracle, a VC focused on building, growing, and engaging decentralized communities. At CryptoOracle, Lou started CryptoMondays, one of the largest crypto Meetup groups in the world, with chapters in over 50 cities. Prior to CryptoOracle, Lou was a Partner at the decentralized VC, Flight, where he managed The Israel Founders Syndicate. Prior to Flight, Lou was the Managing Partner of The Social Internet Fund (SIF), which invested in shares of rapidly growing tech companies. Prior to SIF, Lou was an angel investor, best known for investing in Facebook and writing the first Wall Street style research report on the company in 2010. Before angel investing, Lou ran two digital companies, Bolt (the largest social network before MySpace), and .tv, which commercialized the top-level domain (.tv) licensed from the tiny island nation of Tuvalu. .tv was acquired by Verisign. Prior to .tv, Lou had a distinguished career as an equity analyst following media and tech companies for Goldman Sachs and Merrill Lynch. Lou has a B.A. from U.C.L.A. and an MBA from The Stanford Graduate School of Business.

name: Joshua Lapidus
post:
Membership Steward, Opolis &
Co-Founder, Pool-Party & 
Meta Steward, ETHDenver &
Summoner, ChessDAO
htmldesc: Joshua Lapidus is the Membership Steward at Opolis, Co-Founder of Pool-Party, Meta Steward of ETHDenver, and Summoner of ChessDAO, where he serves as the DAOplomat to UberHaus. He works primarily on "Future of Work" type things in the DeFi-DAO space. Formerly of ConsenSys and Lyft.

name: Hsin-Ju Chuang
htmldesc: CEO & Founder of Dystopia Labs. Was the former Head of Growth at Stellar, Ex-Head of Growth at Solana, & then Ex-Director at Tezos.
